Rest API documentation¶

REST API main¶

Main FastAPI application module.

This module initializes the FastAPI app, configures middleware, exception handlers, and includes routers for authentication, user, and contact management.

author:

DimaKisiv

REST API configuration schemas¶

Schemas for contacts and users.

This module defines Pydantic models for contacts and users, used for validation and serialization in the API.

class src.configuration.schemas.ContactBase(*, first_name: str, last_name: str, email: EmailStr, phone: str, birthday: date, extra_data: str | None = None)¶

Bases: BaseModel

Base schema for a contact.

birthday: date¶
email: EmailStr¶
extra_data: str | None¶
first_name: str¶
last_name: str¶
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

phone: str¶
class src.configuration.schemas.ContactCreate(*, first_name: str, last_name: str, email: EmailStr, phone: str, birthday: date, extra_data: str | None = None)¶

Bases: ContactBase

Schema for creating a new contact.

model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

class src.configuration.schemas.ContactOut(*, first_name: str, last_name: str, email: EmailStr, phone: str, birthday: date, extra_data: str | None = None, id: int)¶

Bases: ContactBase

Output schema for a contact, including ID.

id: int¶
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {'from_attributes': True}¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

class src.configuration.schemas.ContactUpdate(*, first_name: str, last_name: str, email: EmailStr, phone: str, birthday: date, extra_data: str | None = None)¶

Bases: ContactBase

Schema for updating an existing contact.

model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

REST API configuration swagger¶

Swagger/OpenAPI configuration for FastAPI application.

Defines tags metadata and OpenAPI keyword arguments for API documentation.

REST API database Contacts Repository¶

src.database.contacts_repository.create_contact(db: Session, contact: ContactCreate, user_id: int)¶

Create a new contact for a user.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy session.

  • contact (ContactCreate) – Contact creation schema.

  • user_id (int) – ID of the user.

Returns:

The created Contact object.

Return type:

Contact

src.database.contacts_repository.delete_contact(db: Session, contact_id: int, user_id: int)¶

Delete a contact for a user.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy session.

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact.

  • user_id (int) – ID of the user.

Returns:

Deleted Contact object or None if not found.

Return type:

Contact or None

src.database.contacts_repository.get_contact(db: Session, contact_id: int, user_id: int)¶

Retrieve a single contact by ID for a user.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy session.

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact.

  • user_id (int) – ID of the user.

Returns:

Contact object or None if not found.

Return type:

Contact or None

src.database.contacts_repository.get_contacts(db: Session, user_id: int, skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100)¶

Retrieve a list of contacts for a user.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy session.

  • user_id (int) – ID of the user.

  • skip (int) – Number of records to skip.

  • limit (int) – Maximum number of records to return.

Returns:

List of Contact objects.

Return type:

list

src.database.contacts_repository.get_upcoming_birthdays(db: Session, user_id: int)¶

Get contacts with upcoming birthdays in the next 7 days for a user.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy session.

  • user_id (int) – ID of the user.

Returns:

List of Contact objects with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

list

src.database.contacts_repository.search_contacts(db: Session, user_id: int, first_name: str | None = None, last_name: str | None = None, email: str | None = None)¶

Search contacts by first name, last name, or email for a user.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy session.

  • user_id (int) – ID of the user.

  • first_name (str, optional) – First name to search.

  • last_name (str, optional) – Last name to search.

  • email (str, optional) – Email to search.

Returns:

List of matching Contact objects.

Return type:

list

src.database.contacts_repository.update_contact(db: Session, contact_id: int, contact: ContactUpdate, user_id: int)¶

Update an existing contact for a user.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy session.

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact.

  • contact (ContactUpdate) – Contact update schema.

  • user_id (int) – ID of the user.

Returns:

Updated Contact object or None if not found.

Return type:

Contact or None

REST API database Models¶

SQLAlchemy models for contacts and users.

Defines database tables and user roles for the application.

Bases: Base

SQLAlchemy model for a contact.

Bases: object

User role constants.

REST API database Session¶

Database session and engine setup.

Provides SQLAlchemy engine, sessionmaker, and dependency for DB session.

src.database.session.get_db()¶

Dependency that provides a SQLAlchemy database session.

Yields:

Session: SQLAlchemy session object.

REST API database User Repository¶

User repository functions for database operations.

Provides functions to create and retrieve users from the database.

src.database.user_repository.create_user(db: Session, username: str, hashed_password: str, role: str) → User¶

Create a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy session.

  • username (str) – Username of the user.

  • hashed_password (str) – Hashed password.

  • role (UserRole) – Role of the user.

Returns:

The created User object.

Return type:

User

src.database.user_repository.get_user_by_username(db: Session, username: str) → User | None¶

Retrieve a user by username.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy session.

  • username (str) – Username to search for.

Returns:

User object or None if not found.

Return type:

User or None

REST API Routers Auth¶

Authentication router for API.

Provides endpoint for user login and JWT token generation.

src.routers.auth.login(form_data: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), session: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Authenticate user and return JWT access and refresh tokens.

Parameters:

  • form_data (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – Form data with username and password.

  • session (Session) – SQLAlchemy session.

Returns:

Access token and token type.

Return type:

dict

src.routers.auth.refresh_token(refresh_token: str, session: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Refresh access and refresh tokens using a valid refresh token.

Parameters:

  • refresh_token (str) – Refresh token obtained during login.

  • session (Session) – SQLAlchemy session.

Returns:

New access and refresh tokens, and token type.

Return type:

dict

REST API Routers Contacts¶

Contacts router for API.

Provides endpoints for CRUD operations and search on contacts.

src.routers.contacts.create_contact(contact: ContactCreate, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user=Depends(get_current_user))¶

Create a new contact for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact (ContactCreate) – Contact creation schema.

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy session.

  • current_user – Current authenticated user.

Returns:

Created contact.

Return type:

ContactOut

src.routers.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user=Depends(get_current_user))¶

Delete a contact for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact.

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy session.

  • current_user – Current authenticated user.

Returns:

Deleted contact.

Return type:

ContactOut

src.routers.contacts.read_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user=Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve a contact by ID for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact.

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy session.

  • current_user – Current authenticated user.

Returns:

Contact object.

Return type:

ContactOut

src.routers.contacts.read_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user=Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve all contacts for the current user.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – Number of records to skip.

  • limit (int) – Maximum number of records to return.

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy session.

  • current_user – Current authenticated user.

Returns:

List of contacts.

Return type:

list[ContactOut]

src.routers.contacts.search_contacts(first_name: str | None = None, last_name: str | None = None, email: str | None = None, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user=Depends(get_current_user))¶

Search contacts for the current user by first name, last name, or email.

Parameters:

  • first_name (str, optional) – First name to search.

  • last_name (str, optional) – Last name to search.

  • email (str, optional) – Email to search.

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy session.

  • current_user – Current authenticated user.

Returns:

List of matching contacts.

Return type:

list[ContactOut]

src.routers.contacts.upcoming_birthdays(db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user=Depends(get_current_user))¶

Get contacts with upcoming birthdays for the current user.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy session.

  • current_user – Current authenticated user.

Returns:

List of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

list[ContactOut]

src.routers.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, contact: ContactUpdate, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user=Depends(get_current_user))¶

Update a contact for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact.

  • contact (ContactUpdate) – Contact update schema.

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy session.

  • current_user – Current authenticated user.

Returns:

Updated contact.

Return type:

ContactOut

REST API Routers Users¶

User router for API.

Provides endpoints for user registration, profile, avatar upload, and email verification.

src.routers.users.create_user(user_create: UserCreate, session: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Create a new user.

Parameters:

  • user_create (UserCreate) – User creation schema.

  • session (Session) – SQLAlchemy session.

Returns:

Created user.

Return type:

UserRead

src.routers.users.get_me(request: Request, current_user=Depends(get_current_user))¶

Get current authenticated user profile.

Parameters:

  • request (Request) – FastAPI request object.

  • current_user – Current authenticated user.

Returns:

Current user object.

Return type:

UserRead

src.routers.users.request_password_reset(data: PasswordResetRequest = Body(PydanticUndefined), session: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
src.routers.users.reset_password(data: PasswordResetConfirm = Body(PydanticUndefined), session: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
src.routers.users.upload_avatar(current_user=Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db), file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined))¶

Upload avatar for the current user. Only admins can change their own avatar if they are the default admin.

src.routers.users.verify_email(token: str, session: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Verify user email using token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – Email verification token.

  • session (Session) – SQLAlchemy session.

Returns:

Verification message.

Return type:

dict

REST API Security OAuth¶

OAuth2 and JWT security utilities.

Provides functions for token creation, user authentication, and role validation.

author:

Your Name

module:

src.security.oauth

src.security.oauth.create_access_token(data: dict) → str¶

Create a JWT access token for the given data.

Parameters:

data (dict) – Dictionary containing user data to encode in the token.

Returns:

Encoded JWT access token as a string.

Return type:

str

src.security.oauth.get_current_active_admin(user: User = Depends(get_current_active_user))¶

Ensure the current user has admin privileges.

Parameters:

user (User) – User object from dependency injection.

Returns:

The User object if admin.

Return type:

User

Raises:

HTTPException – If user is not an admin.

src.security.oauth.get_current_active_user(user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → User¶

Ensure the current user is active.

Parameters:

user (User) – User object from dependency injection.

Returns:

The active User object.

Return type:

User

src.security.oauth.get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → User¶

Retrieve the current user from the JWT token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – JWT access token from OAuth2 scheme.

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy database session.

Returns:

User object if credentials are valid.

Return type:

User

Raises:

HTTPException – If credentials are invalid or user not found.

REST API Security Passwords¶

Password hashing and verification utilities.

Provides functions to hash and verify passwords using bcrypt.

src.security.passwords.get_password_hash(password: str) → str¶

Hash a password using bcrypt.

Parameters:

password (str) – Plain text password.

Returns:

Hashed password.

Return type:

str

src.security.passwords.verify_password(plain_password: str, hashed_password: str) → bool¶

Verify a plain password against a hashed password.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – Plain text password.

  • hashed_password (str) – Hashed password.

Returns:

True if password matches, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

REST API Services User Service¶

User service utilities for authentication, registration, and avatar management.

Provides functions for user creation, authentication, avatar updates, and email verification.

author:

Your Name

module:

src.services.user_service

src.services.user_service.authenticate_user(db: Session, username: str, password: str) → User | None¶

Authenticate a user by username and password.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy database session.

  • username (str) – Username to authenticate.

  • password (str) – Plain text password to verify.

Returns:

User object if authentication succeeds, else None.

Return type:

User | None

src.services.user_service.create_user(db: Session, username: str, password: str, role: str) → User¶

Create a new user with the given credentials and role.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy database session.

  • username (str) – Username (must be a valid email address).

  • password (str) – Plain text password.

  • role (UserRole) – Role for the new user.

Returns:

The created User object.

Return type:

User

Raises:

HTTPException – If username is invalid or already exists.

src.services.user_service.get_user_by_username(db: Session, username: str) → User | None¶

Retrieve a user by their username.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy database session.

  • username (str) – Username to search for.

Returns:

User object if found, else None.

Return type:

User | None

src.services.user_service.update_avatar(db: Session, user: User, file) → str¶

Update the user’s avatar using Cloudinary.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy database session.

  • user (User) – User object whose avatar will be updated.

  • file (Any) – File object containing the new avatar image.

Returns:

URL of the updated avatar image.

Return type:

str

src.services.user_service.verify_email_token(token: str, db: Session, secret_key: str) → str¶

Verify an email confirmation token and mark the user as verified.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – JWT token for email verification.

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy database session.

  • secret_key (str) – Secret key for decoding the token.

Returns:

Confirmation message if verification succeeds.

Return type:

str

Raises:

HTTPException – If token is invalid, expired, or user not found.
